alert.note: Alert for Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 11:38AM EST until December 20 at 3:16AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Pompton River At Pompton Plains affecting Passaic and Morris Counties. For the Pompton River...including Pompton Plains...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pompton River at Pompton Plains. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, The first flooding begins in the area of River Road and Harrison Street. At 16.0 feet, Residences on Pequannock Avenue along the river between Madison and Shady streets become surrounded by water. Businesses along Route 23 north begin to flood. At 17.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Roosevelt Street becomes impassable. Route 23 exit ramp at Alexander Avenue becomes impassable. At 18.0 feet, Pequannock Avenue at Shady Street becomes impassable and blocks Roosevelt and Shady Streets. Oakwood at Shady Street becomes impassable. The first evacuations begin. Flooding occurs on West View Road and the Lower Riverview community areas of Wayne. At 18.5 feet, Route 23, North and South, is impassable and closed. At 19.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs in low lying areas of Wayne, Pequannock and Pompton Lakes. At 20.0 feet, Village section of Pompton Plains begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 19.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EST Tuesday was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 12.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.6 feet on 04/10/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Pompton River Pompton Plains 16.0 19.4 Tue 11 a 14.9 13.1 Crested & falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM EST.
